summary: Email correspondence between Assistant United States Attorney Michael Danchuk and attorney Jack Scarola regarding victim notification and upcoming court proceedings in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The email discusses providing notice to a statutory victim under the Crime Victim Rights Act and schedules for an arraignment and bail appeal hearing.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Attorney receiving and responding to communications from the U.S. Attorney's office regarding victim notification and court proceedings in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Michael Danchuk
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who sent the initial email providing notice of court proceedings to a statutory victim and informing about upcoming court dates.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, with upcoming arraignment and bail appeal proceedings.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over the Ghislaine Maxwell case who scheduled an in-person arraignment for April 23, 2021.

connections.description: Prosecutor communicating with attorney regarding victim notification and court scheduling in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Attorney representing or communicating on behalf of a client in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, though the exact client relationship is not specified.
Assistant U.S. Attorney prosecuting the case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Arraignment on Superseding Indictment
events.description: In-person arraignment scheduled before Judge Nathan at courtroom 24B, 500 Pearl Street, related to a superseding indictment adding a statutory victim.

events.title: Bail Appeal Oral Argument
events.description: Remote oral argument scheduled before the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's bail appeal.

locations: 500 Pearl Street, courtroom 24B (Southern District of New York courthouse)
keyFacts: A superseding indictment has been filed adding a statutory victim to the charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The U.S. Attorney's office is providing notice of court proceedings to a victim pursuant to the Crime Victim Rights Act.
Two significant court dates are scheduled: an in-person arraignment on April 23, 2021, and a remote bail appeal hearing on April 26, 2021.
Attorney Jack Scarola is involved in communications regarding victim notification, suggesting he may represent a victim or party with standing in the case.
The document shows procedural coordination between prosecution and victim representatives in advance of key court proceedings.
